com.googlecode.javastar
Class AstarHelper<N extends Node,C extends Cost<C>>

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.javastar.AstarHelper<N,C>

public abstract class AstarHelper<N extends Node,C extends Cost<C>>
extends java.lang.Object

This class is where most calculations are performed. The user should extend this class and adapt it to his needs.

Note that only abstract methods are required to be implemented. Changes to other methods can cause this package to stop working.

Author:
Steven Roose

Nested Class Summary
static class AstarHelper.NodesNotAdjacentException
          The exception exists because certain methods used in this class only accept nodes that are adjacent to each other.

isHeuristicMonotone

public boolean isHeuristicMonotone()
Let this method return true if the used heuristic is monotone.

Using monotone, or consistent, heuristics makes the A* algorithm faster generally, but it also makes some checks redundant. So, it is not necessary to change this method when a monotone heuristic is used, but it is recommended.
For more information about monotone/consistent heuristics and for the exact conditions, check Wikipedia.
Obviously, this method's default value is false.

Returns:
true if the used heuristic is monotone, false otherwise

getCostBetweenNodes

public abstract C getCostBetweenNodes(N from,
                                      N to)
                                               throws AstarHelper.NodesNotAdjacentException
Calculate the cost to move from node from to adjacent node to.
Throws an exception if the two nodes are not adjacent.

Parameters:
from - the "from" node
to - the "to" node
Returns:
the cost needed to move from node from to node to
Throws:
AstarHelper.NodesNotAdjacentException - If from and to are not adjacent.
| ! areAdjacent(from, to)

getZeroCost

public abstract C getZeroCost()
Method for retrieving a cost object with value zero.
The following must hold:
result.add(someCost).equals(someCost)

Returns:
a cost with value zero

areAdjacent

public abstract boolean areAdjacent(N node1,
                                    N node2)
Check if node1 and node2 are adjacent nodes in the network.

Parameters:
node1 - the first node
node2 - the second node
Returns:
true if the two nodes are adjacent, false if not so

isStopCriteriumEnabled

public boolean isStopCriteriumEnabled()
If this method returns true, the user-defined stop criterium in isStopCriteriumReached() is checked before every expansion.

The default value is false.

Returns:
true if the user-defined stop criterium is enabled, false otherwise

isStopCriteriumReached

public boolean isStopCriteriumReached(long numberOfNodesExpanded,
                                      C costOfCurrentNode,
                                      C heuristicOfCurrentNode,
                                      int pathLengthOfCurrentNode)
This method allows the user to define it's own stop criterium for the calculation. This method is called before every node gets expanded.

This method is only used when isStopCriteriumEnabled() returns true.

Parameters:
numberOfNodesExpanded - the total number of nodes expanded until now
costOfCurrentNode - the cost of the node to be expanded next
heuristicOfCurrentNode - the heuristic value of the node to be expanded next
pathLengthOfCurrentNode - the path length to the node to be expanded next
Returns:
true is the calculation should stop, false if it should continue

expand

public final java.util.Set<PathNode<N,C>> expand(PathNode<N,C> node)
Expand a PathNode to a Set of PathNodes. This method uses the AstarHelper.expand() method and adds cost and heuristic values.

Parameters:
node - the node to expand
Returns:
the expansion of node
